title: feat: update dependencies
feat(key): add Signed(Public|Secret)Key::expires_at() method
body:
I'm missing a "simple" API to get the expiration date of a key, much like the `expires` or `expired` output of gpg:

```
pub   rsa4096 2014-10-14 [SCEA] [expired: 2018-09-15]
      XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
uid           [ expired] Test User <test@example.com>
```

title: Remove enum_primitive dependency
body: It is not used anywhere in rPGP code.

title: Turn info!() that are used for debugging/tracing into debug!()
body:
This would greatly improve the logging in applications that are using rpgp.
Note that some of those message could even become trace!().

See issue #75.

title: refactor!: remove email module
body: It is not complete and is not used in Delta Chat

title: Improve documentation and comments
Implement is_encryption_key for KeyTrait
Return true from is_signing_key for ECDSA keys
Clarify error message for EdDSA encryption
body:
"EdDSA encryption" is not going to be implemented. ECDH case is already implemented.

Closes issue #66

title: fix: do not log sensitive information
body:
Logs may be leaked accidentally and additional processing increases the
chance that this information will remain in memory.

Logging can be added as needed if required for debugging.

Related to #43

title: CI: Add cargo audit job
feat: return the same error from decrypt_protected on invalid MDC
body:
Previously `checksum::sha1()` called `ensure_eq!` and the resulting error
propagated upwards.  As it can end up in the logs or UI, it is better
to make it more generic to avoid accidental information leaks.

Additionally, compute SHA1 in advance, before performing the checks.
In the future, these checks can be made constant time, even though it
is out of scope of rPGP threat model for now.

title: fix(line-reader): improve correctness of LineReader::seek
body:
Currently `LineBreak::seek` processes only `io::SeekFrom::Current(n)` and immediately converts `n` to its absolute value.

I test that forward and backward seek works as expected (currently it doesn't, hence draft PR).
